handler:

Will attempt to constrain the resize node to the boundaries. Arguments:
'view': Contrain to Viewport
'#selector_string': Constrain to this node
'{Region Object}': An Object Literal containing a valid region (top, right, bottom, left) of page positions
variable.name: constrain

variable.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.
variable.name: destroyed

variable.description: The handles to use (any combination of): 't', 'b', 'r', 'l', 'bl', 'br', 'tl', 'tr'. Can use a shortcut of All.

variable.description: Resize a proxy element instead of the real element.

variable.description: True when the element is being Resized.
variable.name: resizing

variable.description: The number of x ticks to span the resize to.

variable.description: True to wrap an element with a div if needed (required for textareas and images, defaults to false) in favor of the handles config option. The wrapper element type (default div) could be over-riden passing the wrapper attribute.
variable.name: wrap

variable.description: Elements that requires a wrapper by default. Normally are elements which cannot have children elements.
variable.name: wrapTypes

variable.description: Element to wrap the wrapTypes. This element will house the handles elements.

variable.description: Always show the results container, instead of only showing when the user is requesting them.

variable.description: Automatically highlight the first item in the list when the results are made visible.

variable.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.
variable.name: boundingBox

variable.description: To use a button

variable.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendent of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.
variable.name: contentBox

variable.description: CSS class to be automatically added to the boundingBox.
variable.name: cssClass

variable.description: The data source that results will be read from. This can either be an existing DataSource object, or it can be a value that would be passed to DataSource.
variable.name: dataSource

variable.description: The type of the data source passed into dataSource. This can be used to explicitly declare what kind of DataSource object will be created.
variable.name: dataSourceType

variable.description: The character used to indicate the beginning or ending of a new value. Most commonly used is a ",".
variable.name: delimChar

variable.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.
variable.name: destroyed

variable.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.
variable.name: disabled

variable.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.
variable.name: focused

variable.description: If typeAhead is true, this will clear a selection when the overlay closes unless a user explicitly selects an item.
variable.name: forceSelection

variable.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.
variable.name: height

variable.description: css class added to hide the boundingBox when visible is set to false.
variable.name: hideClass

variable.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.
variable.name: initialized

variable.description: The input field which will recieve the users input.

variable.description: The key or numeric index in the schema to match the result against.

variable.description: The maximum number of results to display.
variable.name: maxResultsDisplayed

variable.description: The minimum number of characters required to query the data source.
variable.name: minQueryLength

variable.description: The amount of time in seconds to delay before submitting the query.
variable.name: queryDelay

variable.description: When IME usage is detected or interval detection is explicitly enabled, AutoComplete will detect the input value at the given interval and send a query if the value has changed.
variable.name: queryInterval

variable.description: When applyLocalFilter is true, setting this to true will match only results with the same case.
variable.name: queryMatchCase

variable.description: When applyLocalFilter is true, setting this to true will match results which contain the query anywhere in the text, instead of just matching just items that start with the query.
variable.name: queryMatchContains

variable.description: For IO DataSources, AutoComplete will automatically insert a "?" between the server URI and the encoded query string. To prevent this behavior, you can set this value to false. If you need to customize this even further, you can override the generateRequest method.
variable.name: queryQuestionMark

variable.description: If true the render phase will be autimatically invoked preventing the .render() manual call.

A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.

item.label: Sample Entity
item.content:
<entity name="Foo" local-service="true" remote-service="true">
<!-- PK fields -->
<column name="fooId" type="long" primary="true" />
<!-- Audit fields -->
<column name="companyId" type="long" /> <column name="userId" type="long" /> <column name="userName" type="String" /> <column name="createDate" type="Date" /> <column name="modifiedDate" type="Date" />
<!-- Other fields -->
<column name="field1" type="String" /> <column name="field2" type="boolean" /> <column name="field3" type="int" /> <column name="field4" type="Date" /> <column name="field5" type="String" />
<!-- Order -->
<order by="asc"> <order-column name="field1" /> </order>
<!-- Finder methods -->
<finder name="Field2" return-type="Collection"> <finder-column name="field2" /> </finder> </entity>

variable.description: Name to use for prefix of primary key (will end with "Id")
variable.name: name

variable.description: Column name
variable.name: name

variable.description: Type to use for column
variable.name: type
